message.content:
<<<api>>>: String.getBytes
<<<code>>>: class Threading extends Thread{
    Socket server;
    Socket client;
    StringBuilder Request;
    Threading(Socket sck,Socket srv){
        client = sck;
        server = srv;
        Request = new StringBuilder();
    }
    @Override
    public void run() {
        try
        {
            DataOutputStream clientout = new DataOutputStream(client.getOutputStream());
            BufferedReader clientinput = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(client.getInputStream()));
            System.out.println("---------REQUEST--------");
            String tmp ="THIS";
            while((tmp=clientinput.readLine())!=null)
            {
                Request.append(tmp);
            }
            System.out.println(Request.toString());//Request is empty!!!
            DataOutputStream srvout = new DataOutputStream(server.getOutputStream());
            BufferedReader srvin = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(server.getInputStream()));
            srvout.write(Request.toString().getBytes());
            while((tmp=srvin.readLine())!=null)
            {
                clientout.write(tmp.getBytes());
            }
        }
        catch(IOException e){e.printStackTrace();}
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are reading from the client input stream and appending it to the Request StringBuilder. If the Request is empty, it means that the client is not sending any data. The getBytes() method is used to convert the string data into bytes before sending it to the server. Similarly, the received data from the server is converted into bytes before sending it to the client.

<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
